links.title: research!rsc: Defining Go Modules (Go & Versioning, Part 6)
links.description:
As introduced in the overview post, a Go module
is a collection of packages versioned as a unit,
along with a go.mod file listing other required modules.
The move to modules is an opportunity for us to revisit and fix
many details of how the go command manages source code.
The current go get model will be about ten years old when we
retire it in favor of modules.
We need to make sure that the module design will serve us
well for the next decade....

links.title: Berkeley Packet Filter - Wikipedia
links.description: The Berkeley Packet Filter (BPF) provides a raw interface to data link layers, permitting raw link-layer packets to be sent and received. It is available on most Unix-like operating systems. In addition, if the driver for the network interface supports promiscuous mode, it allows the interface to be put into that mode so that all packets on the network can be received, even those destined to other hosts.

links.title: BPF Type Format (BTF) — The Linux Kernel  documentation
links.description:
BTF (BPF Type Format) is the metadata format which encodes the debug info
related to BPF program/map. The name BTF was used initially to describe data
types. The BTF was later extended to include function info for defined
subroutines, and line info for source/line information.

links.title: Polynomial Regression As an Alternative to Neural Nets
links.description:
Despite the success of neural networks (NNs), there is still a concern among
many over their "black box" nature. Why do they work? Here we present a simple
analytic argument that NNs are in fact essentially polynomial regression
models. This view will have various implications for NNs, e.g. providing an
explanation for why convergence problems arise in NNs, and it gives rough
guidance on avoiding overfitting. In addition, we use this phenomenon t...

links.title: Neural Networks Are Essentially Polynomial Regression

The paper is of a provocative nature, … Continue reading Neural Networks Are Essentially Polynomial Regression →

The Linux AIO is designed for, well, Asynchronous disk IO! Disk files are not the same thing as network sockets! Is it even possible to use the Linux AIO API with network sockets in the first place?

The answer turns out to be a strong YES!

links.title: An Asynchronous I/O Module For SQLite
links.description:
NOTE:
WAL mode with PRAGMA synchronous set to NORMAL avoids calls to
fsync() during transaction commit and only invokes fsync() during
a checkpoint operation.  The use of WAL mode largely obviates the
need for this asynchronous I/O module.  Hence, this module is no longer
supported.  The source code continues to exist in the SQLite source tree,
but it is not a part of any standard build and is no longer maintained.
This documentation is retained ...

links.description: The Swiss cheese model of accident causation is a model used in risk analysis and risk management, including aviation safety, engineering, healthcare, emergency service organizations, and as the principle behind layered security, as used in computer security and defense in depth. links.title: Root cause analysis - Wikipedia
links.description: In science and engineering, root cause analysis (RCA) is a method of problem solving used for identifying the root causes of faults or problems.[1] It is widely used in IT operations, telecommunications, industrial process control, accident analysis (e.g., in aviation,[2] rail transport, or nuclear plants), medicine (for medical diagnosis), healthcare industry (e.g., for epidemiology), etc.

links.title: Public Suffix List
links.description: A "public suffix" is one under which Internet users can (or historically could) directly register names. Some examples of public suffixes are .com, .co.uk and pvt.k12.ma.us. The Public Suffix List is a list of all known public suffixes.

links.title: Submit amendments to the Public Suffix List
links.description: In order to make the Public Suffix List as current and accurate as possible, we request that TLD registries put in place processes to keep their section of the list current and accurate. links.title: P.S.: Accelerating Hindsight
links.description:
From time to time, I meet people who really like Lisp but who find
themselves at a loss for words when trying to articulate to others the
various reasons why.  For example, many people agree that good support
for rapid prototyping is a key strength of Lisp.  But what is rapid
prototyping and how exactly is it that Lisp supports it better than
other languages?

links.description: Putt's Law and the Successful Technocrat is a book, credited to the pseudonym Archibald Putt, published in 1981. The book is based upon a series of articles published in Research/Development Magazine in 1976 and 1977.

links.description: An allotment garden (British English),[1] often called simply an allotment, or a community garden (North America), is a plot of land made available for individual, non-commercial gardening or growing food plants. Please would you acknowledge this request.

links.title: Bouba/kiki effect - Wikipedia
links.description: The bouba/kiki effect is a non-arbitrary mapping between speech sounds and the visual shape of objects. Voxer 可以像双向无线电一样在智能手机上即时传送语音，而且还会保存以让你不会错过任何信息。除了音频
信息外，你还可以发送文字、照片及分享你的位置。 

你可以与好友、家人或同事轻松即时地沟通。让分开打电话、发语音邮件、发短信和电子邮件一去不复返吧。
Voxer 更快、更便宜、更省时。Voxer 可在全球任何 3G、4G 或 WiFi 网络中使用。 

此外，Voxer 还将即时通讯提升到了一个新水平，收据功能让你可知道你的信息的送达时间及被每个人听到/
看到的时间！此外，还可以使用分享功能将你的任何信息分享到社交网络，或使用邮件或短信分享。 

加入全球数千万 Voxer 用户以: 
* 享受免费的实时对讲机–一键通 (PTT) 
* 发送语音、文本、照片和位置信息 
* 随时播放信息–都已录制 
* 与好友单聊或群聊 
* 离线也可创建信息 
* 获取新信息通知 
* 没有烦人的广告 
* 可在任何手机数据网络和 WiFi 中使用–非常适合国际使用 
* 可以 2x 或 3x 速度...

links.title: Tencent QQ - Wikipedia
links.description: Tencent QQ (Chinese: 腾讯QQ), also known as QQ, is an instant messaging software service and web portal developed by the Chinese tech giant Tencent. QQ offers services that provide online social games, music, shopping, microblogging, movies, and group and voice chat software. The logo of the software is a winking penguin wearing a red scarf. It is the world's 7th most visited website, according to Alexa.[2]

links.title: Growing up in post-communist Romania - thoughts on learning English · Viorel Sfetea
links.description: “Where did you learn to speak English so well?” my boss asked me one afternoon, as we were searching for a bike part he just lost in front of our office building. “By watching TV”. He laughed, I laughed. “No really”, I continued though, “I used to watch cartoons 4-6 hours every day, when we first got cable, and the cartoons were always in English”. Of course, I studied English in school. Twice a week, for 11 years, but the answer to the question ...

links.title: South Atlantic Anomaly - Wikipedia
links.description: The South Atlantic Anomaly (SAA) is an area where the Earth's inner Van Allen radiation belt comes closest to the Earth's surface, dipping down to an altitude of 200 kilometres (120 mi).  This leads to an increased flux of energetic particles in this region and exposes orbiting satellites to higher-than-usual levels of radiation.

links.title: Much fridge food ‘goes there to die’
links.description:
Americans throw out a lot more food than they expect they will, food waste that is likely driven in part by ambiguous date labels on packages, a new study has found.

links.title: Food desert - Wikipedia
links.description: A food desert is an area that has limited access to affordable and nutritious food,[1][2][3] in contrast with an area with higher access to supermarkets or vegetable shops with fresh foods, which is called a food oasis.[4] The designation considers the type and quality of food available to the population, in addition to the accessibility of the food through the size and proximity of the food stores.[5]
